metadata.title: La industria del ladrillo y la urbanización de San Cristóbal, 1910-1940
metadata.journal_or_publisher: Anuario Colombiano de Historia Social y de la Cultura

relevance.topic: The relationship between the brick industry and urbanization in Bogotá
relevance.relevance: The study examines the impact of technological advancements in brick production on urbanization, highlighting the coexistence of modern and artisanal production methods and their influence on labor and urban development.

design.sample_characteristics: Focus on the southeastern sector of Bogotá, specifically San Cristóbal, during the early 20th century.

key_themes: coexistence of modern and artisanal production
qualitative_data.narrative_descriptions: The study describes the historical development of the brick industry in San Cristóbal, highlighting the coexistence of modern factories and artisanal production, and their influence on urbanization.

historical_context.economic_conditions: Period of urban growth in Bogotá during the early 20th century.
historical_context.institutional_context: Limited state intervention in urban planning, with private developers playing a significant role.

outcomes.main_findings: The brick industry, both modern and artisanal, played a significant role in the urbanization of San Cristóbal, contributing to the development of worker neighborhoods.
outcomes.conclusions: The coexistence of modern and artisanal brick production influenced the urbanization process in San Cristóbal, demonstrating the social construction of space.
